intro: Oreopanax polycephalus, commonly known as the mountain sarsapilla, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its thick, woody stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by berries that turn red when mature. Oreopanax polycephalus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ecological and horticultural study.
